content.description: Climb the cool arete. Nice warmup.
content.location: The multi colored arete. The first appealing boulders you will walk past towards the waterway

content.description: Start low and left, then climb straight up to a tall but secure top out
content.location: 15 yards past the Anarchy boulder on the left side of the heavily used trail.  If approaching from the state park.

content.description: For the sit start the crux is the first 2 moves.  Climb up on some really good jug cracks. Last couple moves are insecure but solid needs cleaning and delimming. I made a hole through the tree
content.location: 45 yards past orbit. Take a right trail goes up to the left. The trail is marked with quartz karens.

content.description: Start down in the cave on a good jug rail, make your way left via a series of cool pinches. Hold the tensiony moves to gain the jug side pulls out left and exit the cave on the giant super bucket, finishing up with a few easy slab moves.
content.location: Hidden in the cave directly next to Hidden in Plain Sight.

content.description: Start on the jugs around the left side of the boulder, work across through some pumpy moves to the mantle/crux
content.location: If heading away from the state park, walk 30 yards past the Anarchy Boulder to where the trail splits. The right trail will take you to the waterway caves; take the lesser used left trail through some light brush to a clearing and this boulder.

content.description: Sit start with wide feet and kinda wide hands. Balancing is the the battle with the first couple moves. Work directly up for the big V crack on top.
content.location: 10 yards to the right of trail face climb. Right on the trail.  Old Town graffiti scratched into the face.(Don't add to the graffiti or you'll suck forever)

content.description: Lieback the left side for the start. Work up and right to stay on the face for a great right hand throw to a pocket jug 2 feet from the top. Covered with leaves up top ledge, follow to the right for walk off.
content.location: Is 5 yd to the right of trail face climb.  Boulder is directly on the trail to waterway and has been dug out.. Also has graffiti scratched in saying Old Town. ( Rocks don't need tramp stamps they're fine the way they are.)

content.description: Start on the obvious shelf and work your way up through the overhanging pinches and slopers to a crux last move into a glory jug.
content.location: Along the trail between the anarchy and orbit boulders there is a trail that will branch off into the labyrinth main. Follow this trail trending left till you have to scramble up a usually muddy slope.  Continue on this trail for another 10 yards and you will come to a clearing with this boulder.

content.description: Start same as for hips - bust out left to the arete. Slap your way up the arete with the help of some slopey crimps on the face.
content.location: Left side of the HIPS boulder

content.description: Sit start on the right of the anarchy boulder and work your way up to the same top-out as the left side.
Sit start with left hand on a slopey crimp and right on the slopey pinch.  For a little added difficulty start matched on the right pinch.
content.location: Near the easy arete climb. Look for a boulder with an A scratched into it with a circle around it.

content.description: Super traverse starts on great two hand jug. Once feet are off the ground just go left high or low. Crux is on back side of boulder 15ft before top out. It's a low off the ground for the crux then starts up to the wide horizontal crack. Great climb for a warm up and cardio.
content.location: In between Orbit and Trail Face. Section of boulder by trail is dug out for other great climbs.

content.description: Hands at head level right hand in finger crack pocket, left hand on a face feature. Move up the crack and mantel up and out. Dyno for the finish.
content.location: 25 feet past the anarchy boulder turn left up hill slightly for another 20 feet into small cove. Climb is in on the right.
